title: Mulberry Home Economics Building
text:
The Mulberry Home Economics Building is a historic school building in <a href="Mulberry%2C%20Arkansas">Mulberry, Arkansas</a>. It is a single-story stone and masonry structure, located off West 5th Street behind the current Mulberry High School building. It has a rectangular plan, with a gable-on-hip roof and a projecting gable-roof entry pavilion on the north side near the western end. The pavilion exhibits modest Craftsman styling, with exposed rafters in the roof and arched openings. The south facade has a secondary entrance near the eastern end, and four irregularly sized and spaced window bays to its west. The building was erected in 1939 with funding assistance from the <a href="National%20Youth%20Administration">National Youth Administration</a>.
The building was listed on the <a href="National%20Register%20of%20Historic%20Places">National Register of Historic Places</a> in 1992.
